Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 SP3 kernel was updated to fix the following issues:

- A previous security update to address CVE-2017-1000364 caused unintended
  side-effects in several other tools, most notably Java. These issues have
  been remedied. [bsc#1045340, bsc#1045406]
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux, specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed), this affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was introduced in 2010).
